text: I'm standing here by the Gowanus Canal
in Brooklyn which flooded this entire
area yesterday but New York City was
prepared for floods winds and storm
surges one thing that few people were
expecting were fires there have been
fires in New Jersey Connecticut the
Bronx in Brooklyn
but the worst fire by far has been in
Breezy Point Queens where my colleague
Cory Cole Gannon has been talking to
victims firefighters and residents I
mean how could this happen really
we're here in the Breezy Point section
of the Rockaways in Queens in New York
City it's a few hundred houses on the
beach on the ocean in New York and they
got slammed by Hurricane sandy last
night but what they also got was a
massive fire this fire started around
seven o'clock and it was whipped up by
the tremendous winds with the hurricane
it spread to dozens of houses some of
the people who were fighting the fire
said that maybe 60 70 or upwards number
of houses were involved now people who
have lived in the Rockaways for a long
time say they've they've never seen a
storm like this I mean you know the big
a lot of them say the ocean at the bay
which means the ocean on one side the
waters rose up and they connected with
the waters from the bay on the other
side and you know the streets turned
into rivers
the water was chest high rolling down it
I saw a fridge or a refrigerator on top
of a car on one Street so I used timber
on top of another car people were
shocked that this thing really it lived
up to all the hype and and all the
predictions
throw fire in the mix right now I can't
think of it we've seen people green
being brought out on little rafts on
little sailboats floating down the
street and then now the National Guard
and the cops are coming the fire
department ambulances and they're really
looking for people who may still be in
there
this may be the part of New York City
that's you know really right on the
ocean it's it's basically an urban area
right on the Atlantic Ocean so this may
have been the worst hit and you know
it's gonna be a long time before I mean
all the homes that have serious damage
and it's gonna be a long time before
things have brought back to normal here
there have been no reported fatalities
from the fires but officials are still
assessing the damage and investigating
the cause we'll be following the
developments in the coming days
